replies.body:
- Disable your enter key while in game.
- Drag your chat off-screen.
- Mute everyone at the start of the game.
- Stop worrying about what other people (who you can't control) are doing, and worry about your own play.
- Play games that aren't ranked sometimes so you aren't constantly in high stakes matches.
- Put less emphasis on winning, and more on improving.

JINXED PORO
April 2nd 2019, 11:03:41 pm
Hello,

Buzzing through your ticket here.

Jinxed Poro scouting ahead for the Player Behavior Team.

Thank you for writing in and sharing your thoughts on this matter.

Our systems reviews the behavior of all players equally but on an individual basis. So it doesn’t matter what someone else was doing or saying in your games as retaliation of any kind isn’t okay. If other players’ behavior needs to be addressed they will be reviewed as well and issued the correct punishment in time. Remember, you are responsible for your own behavior only and it doesn't matter who "started it."

There is no need to let yourself get dragged down with negative players when you have the easy option of muting and ignoring them. Choosing to lash out at others in this manner isn’t acceptable and only makes the game experience worse for everyone else.

Keep in mind, that even if you yourself do not find the use of certain words to be offensive, we take our feedback directly from our community.

Calling someone "retard", "%%%%" or "fkn wastes of air" for example or dropping the "F" bomb are not tolerated in our community and it is considered negative behavior, as is making fun of other players ("18:33] 00shots00 (Kled): and a root you virgin | 00shots00 (Kled): who actually wins in life? | 00shots00 (Kled): deffs not your mother | 00shots00 (Kled): she gave birth to you").

Regardless of the other player’s actions, this does not justify your own behavior. You alone are responsible for your actions within the game.

I personally mute and report negative behavior and use pings and emotes to communicate with the team, focusing only on my own gameplay.

The break you took and the other activities were a good idea, sadly tempers still ran high and it ended in this bad situation. :(

The two week suspension was meant to serve as a last warning and a chance for you to improve your in-game behavior. The punishments do escalate, I really can't give you too many details regarding how exactly our IFS system works as it is sensitive information and it can easily be abused. What I can tell you is that you are closely being monitored after you get a toxicity punishment and it there is still a negative behavior pattern in your games it escalates to the next step. The reform period is a lot longer than you surmised, we really do need to see a lot of continuous clean games before we can consider restoring an account's good name.

We treat all our players the same, and we hold everyone accountable for their own behavior. We expect everyone to be civilized and considerate of other people they are playing with. For this reason, we don't condone any type of unsportsmanlike and negative behavior in League of Legends.

While we understand that emotions run high and there are situations where everyone is short-tempered that does not mean we won't take action if players cross the line.

That being said, I am sorry to inform you that we will neither remove nor modify your account suspension.

I sincerely hope you understand and wish you good fortune.

Jinxed Poro
Player Support Specialist
